data.title: Good food
data.text: The interior is very 1960's. Think "Mad Men." We thought the food was good and our waitress Emme was rather sassy, which I like. They recently restored the vintage windmill on top of the building.

data.title: Best Dennys around
data.text: I went here after a late flight into lax.  The service was prompt and food prepared surprisingly well.  Even though it was busy, the server was still attentive.  Go with confidence

data.title: Breakfast with a smile
data.text:
Love this Denny's. Old school, was once something ales like a bakery.  Has an old lighted wind mill atop the roof.  Other than that, it's a Denny's.

Great polite staff and a cool location

data.title: Breakfast Time!
data.text: We went here twice in June. Good Service, prices. Good for everyone! blueberry pancakes, bacon, eggs. Yummy in the Tummy Denny's!

data.title: The Windmill is Turning!
data.text: Thanks to a project spearheaded by local Car Wash magnate George Fasching along with a great deal of public support, the old Van de Kamp's windmill which sits atop this landmark Denny's restaurant is once again proudly turning.   Definitely worth a trip.

data.title: Slow Service
data.text: Went during 11am and wasn't really busy but we got the slowest waitress and ignored for about 10 minutes till we told the manager we had been waiting. We got our drinks right away but had to wait to order our food cause she couldn't get it right away.  If you have time then go here if not don't waste your time.

data.title: Know what you are going to get at Denny's.
data.text: Don't expect much, and you won't be disappointed, ok?  What do you expect with cheap foods?  You get what you pay for, right?

data.title: Denny's for a Reliable American Menu
data.text:
This Denny's is located in the windmill building that was originally built as a Van DeKamp's Restaurant in the 1960's, when it was painted blue and white and the big windmill on the top of it actually rotated.   But Denny's took it over after it closed, and painted the building brown, along with unplugging the windmill.  So it's in a unique building, but just like every other Denny's in the USA, it isn't any different from any of the others when reading the corporate menu.

This isn't to say that it's bad, because it's just as good as any of the Denny's I've ever been to.  The Grand Slam Breakfasts are great and very filling, the pancakes are wonderful, and the hamburgers are the traditional variety.  All good, and so was the service.  You always know what to expect, and for that reason I really like it when I see a Denny's sign when traveling.

data.title: BREAKFAST OR NOT
data.text: Our combination of breakfast and lunch meal are average. But the staff are so helpful and friendly. It is a clean nice place to relax.

data.title: A Birthday meal
data.text:
I went to Denny's for my 83rd  birthday meal with my American grand children.
( Much to the surprise of their parents)
I always like to take my grand kids to Denny's. They love it.
It is homely - as I imagine an old fashioned diner to be.. 
Even though there was a problem in the kitchen and we were plied with drinks etc.  when the food came it was as good as it always is.
The staff were nice, courteous  and helpful.
Each of us had exactly what we wanted and liked,
Despite the long wait we had a good time and I had a good birthday.
It is also reasonably priced and has a separate menu for  " seniors" if we chose to use it.

data.title: Average Slam
data.text: In a hurry, Rods was very busy and so was the Lion place accross the street, so we had to eat here. Its Dennys so it was Dennys like. Hot, Fast and average.

data.title: Very friendly service early in the morning, and excellent comfort food.
data.text:
My wife and I arrived in Arcadia very early one morning back in May for our son's graduation from Occidental College.  Our flight had arrived at LAX before 6:30 AM and naturally our hotel was not ready to check in to.  We needed a hearty breakfast and went to Denny's, yes Denny's.

The waitress that served us went out her way to be friendly and helpful.  I can honestly say that we went from being sleepy and tired to happy and very satisfied within 30 minutes.  I credit the waitress for going beyond the call.  I don't recall her name, but when we're back in Arcadia, you can bet that we'll return to this Denny's restaurant.  Thanks Denny's!

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: Friendly staff and a good breakfast menu. It is a long time since I have eaten in a Denny's but everything looked familiar and the food was good and plentiful.

data.title: Incredible service
data.text: We were meeting friends we had not seen in ages.  The staff there was professional, and so attentive, I could hardly believe it.  They sensed that this was a 'homecoming' - and did all they could to make it so easy-breezy for all of us.  Wow - what a crew.  Our thanks to you.

data.title: Windmill Dennys on Route 66!
data.text: Kudos to Denny's for saving this former Van de Kamps windmill restaurant and keeping it going all these years! Cozier than your typical Denny's, open 24/7, comfort food, endless refills of coffee...in my book, that's everything a roadside diner should be!

data.title: Pumpkin Bliss
data.text:
Cheryl are waitress was great. greeted us promptly. They have a great menu for all ages. We had the pumpkin pancakes they were very good. Only limited time. They have a great menu for seniors, kids. Reasonably price. Great service, nice deco. The fruit, toast, eggs, bacon coffee
were good. There open 24 hours.
 we will be back!

data.title: Outstanding breakfast
data.text: Visited this summer - excellent breakfast.  Great service.  Busy but got our booth quickly. Usually get good service and food in Dennys across various States - the breakfasts have become a part of our trip - usually at least two each time.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: My lunch experience at this denny's was decent here. Waitress was quick to take our order and very fast serving our orders.

data.title: Vegan Skillet
data.text: We live nearby and have been coming to this Denny's for years. We often share a $2 pancake and coffee for breakfast and also their very good veggie burger for lunch, more than enough for the two of us. Just yesterday we asked our waiter, Jay AR, if we could have a skillet with the meat replaced by a veggie patty. He found out that it was possible and so we ordered  their skillet dinner which includes a salad, the skillet and piece of pie, all for only $8.99. We split each of the items and it was more than enough to satisfy us. Also, the new coffee blend was great, both the regular and the decaf. Our waiter was more than attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. We will be back..

data.title: Best place for a work time lunch.
data.text: Food is consistently good, service has historically been excellent at lunchtime.  Dinner is another story completely.  The lunch wait staff has been there for many years, know the regulars, and it feels like going to your aunt's home.  They really know how to take care of you at lunch.
